intro: Parthenium cineraceum, commonly known as the ash-gray parthenium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is an annual herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, grayish-green leaves. The plant produces fluffy, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are often mistaken for dandelion blooms. It thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in open fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Parthenium cineraceum is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize new areas, making it a common weed in many regions.
